Title: [L08] Lack of input validation
Content:
In the `Store` contract:


* The [`setWeeklyDelayFee` function](https://github.com/UMAprotocol/protocol/blob/9d403ddb5f2f07194daefe7da51e0e0a6306f2c4/core/contracts/oracle/implementation/Store.sol#L134) does not validate whether the `newWeeklyDelayFee` parameter is less than 1.


In the `VoteTiming` library:


* The [`init` function](https://github.com/UMAprotocol/protocol/blob/9d403ddb5f2f07194daefe7da51e0e0a6306f2c4/core/contracts/oracle/implementation/VoteTiming.sol#L20) does not validate that the `phaseLength` parameter is greater than zero. This is important to avoid unexpected divisions by zero in other functions of the library.


In the `Shared` library:


* The [`addMember` function](https://github.com/UMAprotocol/protocol/blob/9d403ddb5f2f07194daefe7da51e0e0a6306f2c4/core/contracts/common/implementation/MultiRole.sol#L37) does not do a null address check like the [`resetMember` function](https://github.com/UMAprotocol/protocol/blob/9d403ddb5f2f07194daefe7da51e0e0a6306f2c4/core/contracts/common/implementation/MultiRole.sol#L14) of the `Exclusive` library.


Consider implementing the necessary logic where appropriate to validate all relevant user-controlled input.


**Update:** *Fixed in [PR#1212](https://github.com/UMAprotocol/protocol/pull/1212). The suggested validations are implemented.*
